Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
CAN: Draw basic shapes that may represent animals, such as circles or ovals, but without recognizable features.
Attempt to draw a habitat, such as a body of water or trees, but without clear distinctions or labels.
CANNOT: Label plants and animals correctly in their natural habitats (e.g., labeling a fish as a tree) *(student misunderstands what to label)*.
Illustrate or describe specific places correctly where plants and animals live (may place deer underwater) *(student lacks understanding of habitat)*.
Show clearly what plants and animals need to survive (e.g., no depiction of water, air, or sunlight) *(student is unaware of survival needs)*.
Represent how plants and animals use resources from their environment (e.g., a tree is drawn in air without ground) *(student doesn't connect resources to survival)*.
Draw connections between plants, animals, and environmental resources (e.g., randomly scattered elements with no obvious relationship) *(student cannot connect concepts)*.
Illustrate the concept of interconnected systems in habitats (e.g., animals and plants drawn without any interaction) *(student shows no system understanding)*.
